did.abstract: An 1828 deed between Esther and Mary Craft, releasing their claims from the estate of their father, James Craft, to their brother Isaac Craft.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. D. Irving Mead, 1957.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: The Craft family was from Queens County, though the deed indicates that Esther, Mary, and Isaac Craft were all living in New York City by 1828.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Craft family deed, 1977.498, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Quit claim deed between Esther and Mary Craft, releasing their claims from the estate of their father, James Craft, to their brother Isaac Craft. It is dated June 2, 1828.
